intro: Tylophora linearis, commonly known as the slender tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Tylophora linearis is valued in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
